original: Subscriber to duly complete and execute a Subscription Agreement to be used for U.S Subscribers; (vi) the Agent represents and warrants that with respect to Offered Shares to be sold in reliance on Rule 506(b) of Regulation D, none of it, the U.S. Affiliate, any of its or the U.S. Affiliate’s directors, executive officers, general partners, managing members or other officers participating in the Offering, or any other person associated with the Agent who will receive, directly or indirectly, remuneration for solicitation of Subscribers of Offered Shares pursuant to Rule 506(b) of Regulation D (each, a “Dealer Covered Person” and, together, “Dealer Covered Persons”), is subject to any Disqualification Event except for a Disqualification Event (i) covered by Rule 506(d)(2)(i) of Regulation D and (ii) a description of which has been furnished in writing to the Corporation prior to the date hereof; (vii) the Agent represents that it is not aware of any person (other than any Dealer Covered Person) that has been or will be paid (directly or indirectly) remuneration for solicitation of Subscribers in connection with the sale of any Offered Shares pursuant to Rule 506(b) of Regulation D; and (viii) the offering of the Securities in the United States has been conducted by us in accordance with the terms of the Agency Agreement, including Schedule A attached hereto.

Title: Modification of Performance Obligation Clause

Original Clause: The Seller shall deliver the Goods to the Buyer at the agreed location within 30 days from the date of this Agreement, without prejudice to the Buyer's right to accept or reject the Goods.

Rewritten Clause: The Buyer shall accept delivery of the Goods from the Seller at the agreed location within 30 days from the date of this Agreement, with the understanding that failure to do so shall not be deemed a rejection of the Goods by the Buyer.

Explanation: The original clause puts an obligation on the Seller to deliver the goods to the Buyer within 30 days. In the revised clause, the obligation is shifted onto the Buyer to accept delivery within 30 days, and failure to do so will not be considered a rejection of the goods by the Buyer, implying that the Buyer may still have the right to reject the goods at a later date if they choose. This revised clause weakens the obligation on the Seller while maintaining the professional and realistic tone of the original clause.
